intro: Xylopia gracilis, commonly known as the slender wax tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Annonaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, woody stems and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by fleshy, yellowish berries. Xylopia gracilis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
